metadata.title: CVE-2023-42852 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
A logic issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed iniOS 17.1 and iPadOS 17.1, watchOS 10.1, iOS 16.7.2 and iPadOS 16.7.2, macOSSonoma 14.1, Safari 17.1, tvOS 17.1. Processing web content may lead toarbitrary code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-42852` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.42.2-0ubuntu0.23.04.1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
